subject: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
To The Attention of: The Beneficiary ,
I refer to our joint meeting with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in which matters bothering on delayed payments has been the order of the day from various
beneficiaries globally.
We resolved that urgent attention will be taken in order to settle this in no distant time. Three options were considered and approved . Our first option is for any
 beneficiary willing to be physically present in the Texas United States of America to be paid through the World Bank Representatives. In this arrangement , no upfront fee is required until the person decides to make the trip for his / her payment.
Secondly , we have a Financial firm in the Netherlands that can affect the transfer of the funds with also no upfront payment. When the firm affects the transfer , the funds will be in your account for your confirmation but it will be on hold.The alert of the transfer must be received by you .The financial firm will never ask you for any cent until the transfer is made for your confirmation.
Thirdly, our payment Agent Euro Clear Financial Consultant  in the US will pay through their Euro Clear Payment Bond which must be confirmed when issued . Euro Clear will never request an upfront fee until you confirm their Bond which will come from either HSBC or Barclay Bank.
It was too difficult for us to reach this conclusion but we must have to bring smiles to the face of our beneficiaries . If you consider any of our payment options acceptable,do let us know while we follow up urgently.
Your response is awaited.
Regards,
Travis Kimbell
The IMF Representative,
London Office

subject: Re:   To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your detailed message. It's great to hear that the Monetary Fund IMF is taking steps to address delayed payments. I appreciate the options you've provided, they all seem very considerate and flexible.

I'm a bit curious about the first option though. If I choose to be physically present in Texas, United States, how would the payment process work through the World Bank? Would there be any specific procedures or requirements?

As for the second option, could you please provide more information about this Financial firm? How does it operate and ensure secure transfers?

Lastly, regarding the Euro Clear Financial Consultant, could you explain more about what a Euro Clear Payment Bond is? And how can it be confirmed from HSBC or Barclay Bank?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
To The Attention of : Anna  (Madam)
Your message has been received and content duly noted. Firstly , if you ask
me as a Financial expert , I will advise you to follow the second or third
options as both are less cost effective than the first option.
If you choose the 1st option , it will require you paying the Clearing and
Handling charges not in advance but will pay upon you meeting the payment
Agent one on one in Texas. The Clearing and Handling charges are not more
than $13,870.

If you decide to choose a Euro Clear Financial Consultant in the US , they
will issue their Euro Clear payment Bond which you will confirm through
your Bank . The moment the confirmation of the Bond is done, Euro Clear
will request for their Insurance premium charge before they credit your
account within 72 hours.You have the right to make your choice but i have
to guide you in order not to run at a high cost .
Regards,
Travis Kimbe.

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbe,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining these options to me. As someone who isn't very savvy with financial matters, it's great to have an expert guiding me through this process.

I'm leaning towards the second option as it seems less cost-effective, but I do have a few questions. Could you please elaborate on what the Euro Clear payment Bond is? And how does the insurance premium charge work?

Also, could you provide more information about the payment agent in Texas? What would be the process of meeting them one-on-one?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining these options to me. I must admit, some of this financial jargon goes over my head a bit!

If it's not too much trouble, could you please break down the second and third options a little more? I'm particularly interested in understanding what the 'Clearing and Handling charges' involve. Also, could you explain what a 'Euro Clear payment Bond' is?

I'm just trying to make sure I fully understand everything before making a decision.

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention: Anna ,

Having read and understood your questions , here are my answers to your two
questions.

Firstly , if you accept the cash payment option , the Clearing and Handling
charges that our payment Agent in Texas will request from you covers the
security of the funds and clearing expenses from the Airport . There is no
way both charges will be less or more than $13,000. As soon as they are
taking off from the UK , they will settle the Customs at Heathrow . When
they arrive in Texas , the same must be done. This $13,000 will not be paid
in advance.

Then about Euro Clear payment Bond ,

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention: Anna ,

Having read and understood your questions , here are my answers to your two
questions.

Firstly , if you accept the cash payment option , the Clearing and Handling
charges that our payment Agent in Texas will request from you covers the
security of the funds and clearing expenses from the Airport . There is no
way both charges will be less or more than $13,000. As soon as they are
taking off from the UK , they will settle the Customs at Heathrow . When
they arrive in Texas , the same must be done. This $13,000 will not be paid
in advance.but will be paid when you meet the Agent face to face.

Then about Euro Clear payment Bond ,this an instrument that will be raised
by either HSBC or Barclays Band. Bond is a payment instrument used all over
the world. It has to be verified by a Bank before they know the
authenticity of the instrument. It is after confirmation of the Bond that
they will give you the insurance Premium which is about 0.1 % of the
principal amount due to you.

Sit down and think of the one that is preferable to you .
Regards,
Travis Kimbell..

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite interesting to learn about the process involved in cash payment and the role of the payment Agent in Texas. I'm curious, how does this process ensure the security of funds? 

Also, could you please elaborate more on the Euro Clear payment Bond? How does it work and what are its benefits?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention: Anna ,

In fact I am getting fading up with your series of questions. I have
explained more than two times and yet you keep asking.The surety of the
cash payment arrangement is that the moment you are through with the Agent
in Texas , by your request , they can assist you to make lodgement into any
Bank of your choice .

As for Euro Clear , Bond payment is known all over the World. It is a
confirmable payment instrument. If you want either of the payment options ,
the Notarization letter is required . If you want to start any of the
options , the first thing to obtain is the Notarization payment letter.
Decide and let me know.

Travis Kimbell.

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your patience and for explaining the process to me. I must admit, I'm not very familiar with these financial terms and procedures. Could you please explain a bit more about what a Euro Clear Bond payment is? And how does it work exactly?

Also, could you tell me more about this payment letter? What kind of information does it contain and why is it so important in this process?

I appreciate your help in understanding all of this.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention: Anna ,

The Notarization payment is a legal backing letter for the release of the
fund. The letter will contain all information and the mode of payment to be
used for you.
I have no further information to give you about Euro Clear Payment Bonds. I
think I have already explained enough for you to understand.. Either you
make a choice or you decide to back out.

Travis Kimbell.

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your message. I appreciate the information you've provided about the Euro Clear Payment Bonds. It's all a bit new to me, so I hope you don't mind if I ask a few more questions.

You mentioned a legal backing letter for the release of the fund. Could you please explain what this letter is and how it works? Also, could you provide more details about the mode of payment that will be used?

I'm just trying to understand everything clearly before making any decisions. Thank you for your patience.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time you took to clarify these points for me. 

I'm trying to understand better, so please bear with me as I ask a few more questions. When you mention the Clearing and Handling charges, could you provide a rough estimate of how much these might be? Also, when you say they will be paid face-to-face with the Agent in Texas, does this mean I would need to travel there?

Regarding the Euro Clear payment Bond, it sounds like an interesting method. Could you explain a bit more about how it works? How is it verified by the bank and what does it mean that they know the 'of the'? 

Lastly, could you elaborate on what exactly is meant by 'insurance Premium' and why it's about 'of the principal amount due'?

Sorry for all these questions! Just want to make sure I fully understand everything.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention:Anna ,

I HAVE SPENT MORE TIME ANSWERING YOUR QUESTIONS AND YOU KEEP ASKING MORE.
THE NOTARIZATION PAYMENT LETTER IS LEGAL BACKING FOR THE PAYMENT . IF IN
CASE THERE IS A FAILURE IN PAYING YOU , WITH THAT LETTER , YOU CAN SEEK FOR
A LEGAL ACTION . THE LETTER WILL CONTAIN YOUR NAME , THE AMOUNT TO BE PAID
TO YOU , YOUR BANK ACCOUNT INFORMATION , A COPY OF YOUR ID CARD AND YOUR
ADDRESS .
ALL THIS INFORMATION WILL BE CONTAINED IN THE NOTARIZATION PAYMENT LETTER.

IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF EURO CLEAR FINANCIAL CONSULTANT IN THE US TO
ISSUE DOCUMENTS THAT COPIES WILL BE SENT TO YOUR BANK FOR CONFIRMATION.
IF YOU ARE EAGER / WILLING TO FOLLOW UP , GET STARTED AS I HAVE ANSWERED
ENOUGH OF YOUR QUESTIONS.
REGARDS,
TRAVIS KIMBELL.

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time you've taken to answer my questions. It's clear that this payment letter is an important document.

I'm curious, how does the process of issuing these documents work? And what role does Euro Clear Financial Consultant play in all of this?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention: Anna ,

This may be my last response to your message. Euro Clear has no hand in
getting this Notarization payment letter. We are to apply for it through a
lawyer . The moment the letter is through , a copy will be given to Euro
Clear that you are through with us and they should continue the transfer
process with you and your Bank.

Travis Kimbell

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for your message. It's interesting to hear about the process involving Euro Clear. I'm not very familiar with these procedures, so could you please explain a bit more? How does the application through a lawyer work? And what is the role of Euro Clear in this transfer process?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Anna

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Attention : Anna,
We have expected your response for quite some time now but have not
received it. We are not to persuade our customers, rather we have to
convince them on why they must believe in our performances .Do let us know
why you are doubting our credibility .

Travis Kimbell

subject: Re: To The Attention of: The Ben
body:
Hello Travis Kimbell,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I apologize if my response has been delayed. I'm not doubting your intentions, but I'm just a bit cautious by nature. Could you please provide more details about what exactly you are offering? This will help me understand better and make an informed decision.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Anna
